alert.note: Alert for Dutchess; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 11:07PM EDT until September 10 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Dutchess County in east central New York... Southeastern Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 215 AM EDT. * At 1107 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Poughkeepsie, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Highland, Millbrook, Red Oaks Mill, Fairview, Myers Corner, Marlboro, Modena, Lloyd, Macdonnell Heights, Colonial Heights, Rochdale, Arlington, Manchester Bridge, Clark Heights and Titusville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
